Definition.description: A coordinate reference system based on an ellipsoidal approximation of the geoid; provides an accurate representation of the geometry of geographic features for a large portion of the earth's surface.
Definition.name: urn:ogc:def:derivedCRStype:OGC:1.0:geographic

Definition.description: A coordinate reference system used for recording of heights or depths. Vertical CRSs make use of the direction of gravity to define the concept of height or depth, but the relationship with gravity may not be straightforward.
Definition.name: urn:ogc:def:derivedCRStype:OGC:1.0:vertical

Definition.description: A coordinate reference system with the origin at the centre of mass of the earth. A geocentric CRS deals with the earth's curvature by taking a 3D spatial view.
Definition.name: urn:ogc:def:derivedCRStype:OGC:1.0:geocentric
engineering

Definition.description: A derived CRS used like an engineering coordinate reference system applied to locations in images.
Definition.name: urn:ogc:def:derivedCRStype:OGC:1.0:image

Definition.description: A reference system used for the recording of time.
Definition.name: urn:ogc:def:derivedCRStype:OGC:1.0:temporal
